website_summaries.verdict: These small traps are a good way to humanely eliminate your household rodent issues.
pros: Air holes help the animal breathe
Can be used again and again
Made of a sturdy plastic that other animals, like cats, will not be able to penetrate
A very effective trap for mice
cons: If you forget to check the traps for a long time, a mouse caught inside could die

customer_reviews.title: Perfect design for easy, humane catch and release
customer_reviews.text: I received these in the mail this morning and within 45 minutes, I caught the mouse in my kitchen! The mouse is safe in the trap and my cat can't get to him. I plan to release the mouse in the woods when my kindergartener gets home this afternoon. I simply used a little bit of peanut butter in the end, as is recommended. I was also able to slip a piece of cheese into the tube to feed the mouse after his capture without him escaping. I feel confident that the mouse can't hurt himself in the trap. I would 100 percent recommend these traps!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Bee

customer_reviews.title: This trap works for that hard to catch mouse! ...
customer_reviews.text: This trap works for that hard to catch mouse! I was using a different live catch type trap that I had success with for a while. This last mouse I had though was wise to that trap and would not go in. After weeks of trying different places, treats, and all of that, I decided to try a different trap. This pack came with two. I set both with a different treat in each and caught him on the first night! He has now been released into nature, far away from my house. Simple design but it works well!
customer_reviews.author: DNice

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT, COST EFFECTIVE, EASY HUMANE MOUSE TRAP
customer_reviews.text: Received and set these humane traps immediately. Results within a few hours. Altogether I've caught 10 mice thus far. Particularly effective bait is our dog treat called 'Zukes' Mini Natural Dog Treats.' We put three little pellets in the food reservoir and make sure they stay in that area when the traps are placed (we have two traps; one behind the refrigerator and one in the kitchen closet). Great success.
customer_reviews.author: Marla Sioux

customer_reviews.title: They are great!
customer_reviews.text: I love these traps. With cold weather coming in we always get a few mice. I use these and and catch them, then I poke holes in a water bottle and stick the water bottle in until the mouse goes in it, then take the mice far far far far away and let them go. Because I have 5 kids and we can’t justify killing a cute little disease carrying mouse. :) Picture is how we get the mice out, they just run in the bottles, even the fat ones**
customer_reviews.author: mamaQ

customer_reviews.title: Saved a mouse's life
customer_reviews.text: After multiple day failures with the Tomcat catch and release trap and another brand I can't remember, this one did the trick immediately, the first time I set it. It's a bit bigger than the other traps I tried which was an advantage since I was dealing with a robust mouse. Mouse's tail got caught in it for a bit but he was able to pull it back inside and seemed pretty much ok when I released him over a mile from my house into the woods. He's lucky too, because my patience was running thin with him - if this trap hadn't worked he would be dead instead.
customer_reviews.author: deadwing

customer_reviews.title: Efficient humane trap with big design flaw
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for small field mice but the design has a big flaw. The mice will chew the plastic latch on the trap door rendering it useless after the first catch. They are kept inside the trap but after the first catch, the trap is useless. Used both traps one after the other and the same thing happened. Each mouse was there over night before it was released outdoors. Now the trap's spring door does not close after bate is placed in the rear of the trap. Cleaned the plastic traps and recycled them. Excellent method to catch a mouse but the design of the latch is a major flaw. Mine were both useless after each first catch. No recommendation
customer_reviews.author: Peter DP

customer_reviews.title: Cannot recommend this trap enough!!
customer_reviews.text: The video says it all. I placed a few peanut halves gently on one side of the trap and gently pushed the spring door on the other side. The second night I had it in the garage, I got the little fella. He has since been relocated to a grassy field with lots of areas he can hide and, well, be mousy! 🐭
customer_reviews.author: SDeFranco1

customer_reviews.title: Greens in Your Diet
customer_reviews.text: I bought a two pack of these traps. They do get mice to enter and the trap door does shut, but then the gnawing begins. I caught two mice in the two traps. The first mouse was in the trap for less than 3 hours. He gnawed on the catch that trips the door closed rendering the trap useless after that. One trap-one mouse 5 bucks. The picture is of the second trap bait container which the second mouse gnawed through and lifted the bait container and escaped. Second trap-no mouse another 5 bucks. Grand total one mouse, 10 bucks, two ruined traps, at least one mouse still at large.
customer_reviews.author: KC BOB

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Glad I got it!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly! I discovered a house mouse in my pantry one evening and ordered this human mouse trap because he's really cute and I didn't want to kill it. When the trap arrived, I set it up on my pantry floor and I used peanut butter as the bait. The next afternoon I checked on the trap and he was safely inside! I took him out to a field with lots of trees and brush nearby water where he could live a new life away from my home :-) I opened the trap door and he was so happy to be free he literally bounced ot of there and hopped away
customer_reviews.author: Catt

customer_reviews.title: Too small and too sensitive.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for a mouse and a rat that were coming into my yard to raid my bird feeders. I baited them, they don't really have a good place for the bait, so I put some peanut butter on the pressure plates. They were super sensitive and would often spring while I was placing them down. The door is inside the trap, so it has to be a really small animal to fit inside, too small for a rat. I checked them multiple times a night, I could see the mouse and rat nearby, and the traps were sprung multiple times, but never had anything in them.
customer_reviews.author: Isis the Black

customer_reviews.title: Only caught six mice before they both quite working!
customer_reviews.text: These traps worked flawlessly... for only five days! After catching two mice in one and four mice in the other neither still functions. Both failed because the mice, apparently seeking escape, were able to easily chew-off the little plastic nub on the piece that catches and holds the trap door open until the weight of the mouse causes it to snap shut. This puts the average cost of catching mice at $2.34 each! I have attached a pic of each trap showing where the mouse chewed off the plastic nub.
customer_reviews.author: R. Pollard

customer_reviews.title: JUNK...Lasted one week!
customer_reviews.text: So I put them outside with the peanut butter on the ends. Went outside the next day and one end was totally missing from the rest of the trap. The other trap had the end off and was laying next to the trap with the peanut butter gone. Reloaded them with peanut butter and taped the end on one and made a make-shift end for the other one which was missing. Put them outside and the next day they chewed through the plastic to get to the [peanut butter and the other one with the good end on it is totally missing. These are just cheap little plastic traps for catching mosquito's!
customer_reviews.author: Dar Schiller

customer_reviews.title: This works well.
customer_reviews.text: This has caught several mice so far. Be sure to check regularly though, because I found a dead mouse inside once. I guess I had forgot about the traps.
customer_reviews.author: John Vault

customer_reviews.title: Easily broken by the caught mouse
customer_reviews.text: The trap works, no doubt. Once, at least. However, in the effort to escape, the mouse chews at the plastic knob on the door. While he still cannot escape, the lose of that knob means that the trap no longer works, because it cannot be reset. This happened to both of the traps I bought.
customer_reviews.author: L. Abraham

customer_reviews.title: Got two traps, put them out, caught mice in less than 1 day
customer_reviews.text: These things work great... Now the big challenge is figuring out just how far I have to transport these adorable little mice to prevent them from skittering right back to and into our house! I put one trap out and caught a mouse overnight. Put another one our a few days later and caught a mouse within about a day. I'm not sure if it was the same mouse or a different one, but I took it further away before releasing the second time.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Harris

customer_reviews.title: Too small, only for small mice
customer_reviews.text: Why couldn't they make this trap just a couple inches longer?? Or even one inch longer?? The only way this thing can spring is if the rodent is positioned totally towards the back and the rodent has to be small. I have small and medium rats and I truly doubt it will work, just not long enough. And I have 4 of these traps now and not sure I even want to bother setting them. Should have paid attention its says "Mouse" trap, not "rat" trap.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: I have way more mice in my house than I thought! I put two of these out in my cross base ever night and have two mice every AM. I guess once you see 1 mouse that means you have many more! Up to 12 already! About half way to the 12 I found one mouse smart enough to life the back door up. So now I add a lil tape to it so that it cannot be easily opened. Easy fix and have yet to lose a mouse since then!
customer_reviews.author: C. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome
customer_reviews.text: Stick in a little cheap peanut butter and they are better than the Pied Piper. I caught six mice in my basement in less than 12 hrs. No sooner would I dump the (live) rodent into the woods and reset the thing than I’d catch another one. The only downside I see is trying to clean them. Once there is a significant amount of mouse poop in them, I just throw them out. Otherwise these things are amazing. No poison laying around (you can use them anywhere), no danger to the pets and grandkids, and no pinched fingers in old-style spring traps. Best and most reliable traps I’ve ever found. Cleaned the mice out of my basement in a hurry!
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Successful capture and extraction.
customer_reviews.text: With this device, we caught our little house mouse who’s been terrorizing Mama the last few days. Of course my daughter wanted to keep “her” and named her Buttercup, but we were under strict orders to evict her (although I think Mama actually used the word terminate). Luckily for Buttercup, we were a able to extract her from the hostile environment and let her loose back into the wild, but not before she turned and gave my little girl a glance in gratitude.
customer_reviews.author: FW2

customer_reviews.title: Caught two mice within a couple weeks
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving these traps five stars because they worked for their intended purpose. So far we have caught and (reluctantly) released two cute little mice. My only complaint is that the instructions say that the trap is designed so their tails will not get caught, but both mice we caught had their tails stuck in the gate. The gate Is fairly light so I don’t know if this causes the mouse any pain, but neither mouse seemed to be able to free its tail and one was very distressed. I’m also not sure if it could cause pain when it initially snaps shut. One other comment: the instructions recommend peanut butter but we have had much better luck with raisins.
customer_reviews.author: CaelitaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design, Good for 2 mice and then it's garbage.
customer_reviews.text: The trap performed as promised. Caught the mouse without injury . However, there were 2 design flaws. Flaw One: We had to tape down the back release door, which slid up to be removed because the mice would figure they could escape by getting their feet under the door and lifting. Flaw Two: The catch on the pivot plate, which held the the spring door in place was plastic and stuck out. When the mice couldn’t get out, they started gnawing on the catch and after the 2nd mouse there was no catch to hold the spring door in place. So with 2 traps, we caught 2 mice and after we threw the traps out.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Tobin

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive, strong, no escapes or fails yet!
customer_reviews.text: I have caught several baby (first forage, young- I actually kept a couple in a cage for a couple weeks because I felt so bad about releasing such young mice) and adult field mice in these traps. Peanut butter works best. The platform is very sensitive, and I haven't had fails or escapes. Easy to clean. There are a few areas that poop will catch, so be sure to use a bottle or glass brush, otherwise it will hold the scent of the previous captive. I recommend these traps! You simply hold one end, pull up the bait slider, and shake the mouse out. (far from your home, of course!)
customer_reviews.author: Melo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent concept, but spring board is too sensitive and mice too smart
customer_reviews.text: The spring board where you place food is too sensitive. The slightest bit of weight causes the trap door to close. A tiny, broken off piece of cracker with peanut butter on top was slightly too heavy to keep the door open. Often, a firm tap would cause the trap door to close, so I can imagine a mouse easily setting this thing off by just bumping into it. It didn't work for me in catching the rodent lurking in my home. After 2 weeks, I gave up and resorted to an old fashioned glue trap. I wanted to be humane, but these pesky things were making my home unsanitary by leaving urine and droppings all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: Magnus

customer_reviews.title: Great traps!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for those people that can't kill the mice! My mom was having a mouse problem in her house so I set the typical "fast kill" traps. Well, first night in, it caught the hand of a baby mouse and I'm assuming it died from shock. Absolutely broke my heart!!! I bought these traps immediately. I put peanut butter at the end and the first night in, it caught two baby mice in one and a regular sized mouse in the other! 3 mice in two traps! I set them free in a wooded area. The next night, I caught one in each trap. I would highly recommend these to anyone that doesn't want to kill the mice!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Awesome HUMANE trap! A++++
customer_reviews.text: We have had a rogue mouse problem for a while now. Our cats are on edge in a certain area and the dog food bag was chewed open in a closet. We ordered these two traps, and received them within 48hours. Extremely easy and safe setup, sets in a split second with no risk of hurting yourself. One dab of regular peanut butter and you’re set. I literally set one trap and within ONE HOUR had a nice healthy mouse to re-home. Extremely happy with my purchase, won’t even think of using anything else in the future. Awesome awesome product especially for the price and fact it is humane. ZERO complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Caught 2 Mice, But Check Trap Daily
customer_reviews.text: We caught a mouse the first night! We had a mouse in the house and probably a nest in our wall. The exterminator came out and placed a bait, but I tried these to humanely catch the ones I could. We caught one the night before the exterminator came and released him in a field down the road. Unfortunately we caught one a month later and forgot to check for a week. That defeated the “humane” trapping method. Just a smear of PB and the trap was set easily. I will knock a star off because I haven’t found a good way to sanitize and you know how gross mice are.
customer_reviews.author: Cal Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Words can not fully express how I wonderful this product is. About a month ago we began seeing mice in our garage. I was going to place a kill trap, but on recommendation from my SO we decided we would first try a humane trap. I got the traps in and immidiately baited them and set them out. Not even an hour later I caught the little guy from the picture. Then less than an hour later we caught two more. In the 48 hours since we received this product, we have caught 11 mice. I would happy to recommend this to anyone seeking a working humane lady.
customer_reviews.author: Nglover

customer_reviews.title: These work
customer_reviews.text: These work well just a word of caution. I left for work and idk when’s baby one got into this. But by the time I came home after work day he/|she looked really unwell. And the inside walls were really humid. So,i think they need to make more holes in this, but also, just don’t leave a mouse in there for more than a few hours if possible!!! I checked it as soon as I got home and took him out immediately but really wish I could’ve been there sooner to get him fresh air The three I caught were all transported far away alive & well. Just be careful & gentle, please
customer_reviews.author: Mincoco

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely works - with one caution
customer_reviews.text: Within days of setting these, i started catching mice. Incredibly simple, yet effective. That said, please keep in mind that these traps do need to be checked often. Three of the mice i caught had their tails trapped by the door when it snapped shut. The first time this happened the poor little guy was dead from his injury by the time i got to him (next day or so). Thereafter, i was more vigilant about checking, and discovered the two others with caught tails sooner (within a couple of hours i think), and was able to live release.
customer_reviews.author: anywhere but here

customer_reviews.title: Most humane way to catch mice
customer_reviews.text: I had a mouse in my basement. I could not stand the thought of killing him, after all, he's just trying to live his life and come in out of the cold. And some of the torture devices they sell to get rid of mice are horrifying...not to mention the poisons...which I would never have in my house. This little green safe trap worked great. It was very easy to use and was easy to set up. I put some peanut butter in the one end and the next morning there he was. No harm to him and set him free to be on his merry way. I saw no signs of him returning so was happy.
customer_reviews.author: Sweedon

customer_reviews.title: Trapped in 10 Minutes
customer_reviews.text: We have had a little visitor in our kitchen that we were having trouble capturing. Ordered these, set and in less then 10 minutes we caught him and released. Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with product!
customer_reviews.text: Sooooo, we’ve had a mouse for awhile now (like at least 6 months) that has been successfully evading the cats. So, I bought these off amazon. We didn’t want to kill him, just relocate him. I even had my husband put extra peanut butter in the trap so he would have an extra treat. We caught him the very first night! The next morning my husband comes down for work, and there’s a mouse head in the middle of the kitchen floor....The cats pulled his head out of the trap, and decapitated him...They left the head like they were sending a message!! At least we had good intentions...
customer_reviews.author: Leigha Blake

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Used chunky peanut butter because mice love nuts. Try not to touch it without gloves as they can smell your scent. Place along the wall because rodents like to run along the wall. Place it in a hidden spot so the mice feel comfortable going for the food. Be patient rodents are skiddish and may avoid the trap at first.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: As desired for me, not the mouse!
customer_reviews.text: At first I did not think it worked. After a few weeks I caught 3 mice. Each one I released in a big pile of leaves away from home. I read that 2 miles is best, and not in the open. I open the trap door and it runs out and away. Make sure you check it everyday often so the mouse does not suffocate. And after awhile like in my case the peanut butter got moldy after no mice entered and had to be washed out well. I am in hopes none enter as we have mounds of snow outside, where would I release for their survival?
customer_reviews.author: L. Hagelstien

customer_reviews.title: Caught two mice right away, no shrew
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to set up, but hard to clean due to the floor hinge mechanism. One mouse died in the trap- not the seller's fault (we think a baby dehydrated between the evening and the morning when we checked it). We didn't think we could clean it adequately so we tossed the whole thing. I don't think we have only mice in our garage; I believe we also have a shrew. She's bigger with much darker fur, whatever she is. I don't think she'll fit comfortably and she hasn't tried. So not sure what we'll do with her.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly O.

customer_reviews.title: Works!!
customer_reviews.text: I think these are fantastic. They are small so perfect for mouse which was what I needed. I get at least one mouse each night. Super easy to set and clean and release. It’s nice knowing I’m not making the mouse die a slow death from having just a foot or leg caught and then I have to finish off the job in the morning. It does take more time to go far enough to release them but a price I am willing to pay. Also safe to use around animals and kids. I am using in my chicken outdoor pen. If I don’t catch one I just leave the trap out for the next night.
customer_reviews.author: Lori in California

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, we had one little cute field mouse in ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, we had one little cute field mouse in our home that caused tons of cleaning and chasing after! After trying several traps; yes, even the inhumane ones, I put my foot down, told my husband no more buying traps I was ordering these! To my husband amazement I placed them out with a wheat cracker inside of each one right before bed and next morning...We got him/her! Such a cute little thing...husband drove him out to a field and released him! Money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: I. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: It works!!!
customer_reviews.text: The bait door is a bit messy, the peanut butter we used gets pushed around when you slide the bait door back into the trap, and gets all over the place. Only took 2 nights to catch the mouse we spotted in our kitchen. First night it sprung the door but wasn't far enough inside to get trapped. We used some sunflower seeds in the doorway to lure the mouse in and had success. It was so easy! We drove it a mile away and released it. Glad we didn't have to kill it!
customer_reviews.author: cliffmama

customer_reviews.title: Slow at first, then started catching them like crazy!
customer_reviews.text: Originally the traps didn't seem to work. For two or three weeks they caught nothing but we could still hear them running around at nice. Then suddenly we got one, then the next day another... I don't know if they just needed to get used to them being there or what, but they have been doing a great job catching stuff on a regular basis. We did have one escape artist lift the door, but a small piece of duct tape fixed that problem. Now that we've caught the bulk of them, I've ordered more for places like the basement that may be hiding some more. Definitely worth it, but be patient if it doesn't work at first.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Bond

customer_reviews.title: Works for sure just don't leave the mouse in too long or the side can come up from chewing.
customer_reviews.text: This product works well. My only suggestion is do not leave the mouse in there for more than a few hours as they can chew it and the door with the vent holes slides up slightly. I caught mine late night and by the next morning, the mouse had pushed up the side with the holes slightly by chewing it. Any longer it could have escaped. So bottom line works well but just don't leave it in there to long. If the side with holes "clicked" in place it would be a better design. (See photo)
customer_reviews.author: Lazarus

customer_reviews.title: Best Mouse Trap EVER!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, let me say, it takes me a lot to want to review a product. These work so well I would definitely buy them again! I have caught two mice within hours of putting these out. I recommend using a couple pieces of dog food in the end instead of peanut butter but both the dog food and peanut butter worked. It was just more difficult to clean with peanut butter. I am happy that I can drive the mice far away and let them go so they don’t die. These are the best! Never buying anything else to catch those critters!
customer_reviews.author: Jordin Erickson

customer_reviews.title: They Work
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy that I ordered these traps.. I hate the original kill mouse traps. It is winter now, and the mice come inside. The last 2 days I have caught 2 mice. I baited them with a little piece of cracker with peanut butter on them. When I woke up each morning there was a mouse in the trap. Then I take them outside and release them into an old wood pile. I love it. Returning them back to nature. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia Lyons

customer_reviews.title: 2 wasn't enough for me but these definitely WORK
customer_reviews.text: These work great. I've caught maybe 7 already, so clearly I should have bought a 6-pack!!!! Had to call the exterminator and he put a million wood traps... at least that's a lot better than the sticky traps. I have one for cockroaches and accidentally caught a mouse on it, had to hear him cry and it made me want to cry. But these traps make me feel like a saves some lives.
customer_reviews.author: Nena

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: These worked great! Within three days we caught four mice and were able to release them out in a wooded park. In fact I discovered our first catch one evening around 10:30. We drove it to the park and released it. When we arrived home to put the trap back down we had caught a second one in the other trap. Originally, I had thought about putting the traps in different locations, but ended up putting them within a foot of each other. I used a heaping teaspoon of peanut butter in the bait end. I haven't seen any fresh signs of mice since.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Estes

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Thought my cat was crazy occasionally staring very intently at the ceiling....until one day I went to investigate and found evidence of mice. Got these and had the mice in custody within 3 hours if setting the trap. Good news it was the type of mice that are solitary and non infesting so it’s just that one. Lol released it far away from house in the woods and kept traps set for another week just in case. Super easy to set up, to clean, and worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: LastEchoes

customer_reviews.title: Worked until the mice caught on and learned
customer_reviews.text: We were able to catch 3 mice before they figured out what these were for and started avoiding them entirely. It's been weeks since one has been trapped, but we know they're not all gone since they have been seen running around still, unfortunately. We've tried sweetening the deal by combining raisins and dog food stuck to a peanut butter wall to no avail. I'm sure I'm not the only one 'blessed' with super intelligent mice, so this is quite a big flaw in this humane trapping technique. TL;DR Works if you only need to catch one or two mice, beyond that I don't recommend these. It basically cost me $7 per mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Door opened by mouse
customer_reviews.text: Caught one mouse the first night I put out. Second night, the back door opened by a mouse! It appears that it got trapped: there are a lot of droppings inside, but it got away by opening the back sliding door. Even worse, it looks like the mouse/mice went back inside to cleared out peanut butter, because there are a lot of dropping underneath the trapping plate! I will put them out again and tape down the back sliding door and try again.
customer_reviews.author: john hancock

customer_reviews.title: Great Humane Mouse Trap - Works Very Well
customer_reviews.text: So far we've caught 5 mice in these little traps. They seem to work quite well. If you're having trouble with them, I suggest doing a few searches on the most effective mice baits, try changing the baits, and try changing where you place the traps. We went several days without catching anything, then after experimenting with new baits and locations, we seemed to find the magic spot that lures them in. By the way - maple syrup and chocolate chips were the bait that our mice liked!
customer_reviews.author: LUCK

customer_reviews.title: Good trap
customer_reviews.text: OK I don’t know what the scent question was supposed to mean on the review but it’s never had a smell unless you leave the mouse in it for a long time. LOL but these work great! I love that you can see if there’s a mouse in there or not so it’s not a scary surprise. Sometimes we do find the mouse dead probably dying of a heart attack which makes me feel bad but most of the time if it has a mouse in it it’s alive and we can just let it out in the yard somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Beki

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! I actually had better luck catching mice in areas I didn't see them. I caught 3 in the upstairs bedroom vs. the kitchen (where my roommates and I saw them from time to time). I used peanut butter for the bait. Easy to clean as well. Even better, these traps are safe. My roommate had a friend over, and they brought their dog. The dog picked up the trap in his mouth. If that was a normal mouse trap, that would be ugly. So 5 stars to this trap.
customer_reviews.author: Kalenotwhales

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and extremely effective trap
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up and extremely effective trap. On the first night I caught a mouse in each one, and on the second night I caught two more. If you use peanut butter it will require a bit of soaking and cleaning, but I definitely think it's worth it. I do believe this will only work if you are trying to catch typical sized small mice, as it sounded like some other reviewers were trying to catch rats with little luck. I had no issues with these traps and would happily recommend them to others who want to catch mice in a humane and safe way.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Guilt-free Trap
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! I'd been away for the holidays and came back to a small grey visitor. There he, or she, was on top of my bird seed tin with the sun shining through it's little pink ears. I didn't want it for a roommate, neither did I want to see it crushed in a mouse trap. A little peanut butter and, overnight, it had crawled into the trap for a treat. A short ride later, free in a nice field. Just in case he (she) had a pal, I've set it up again. Guilt-free and efficient mouse trap.
customer_reviews.author: beachreader

customer_reviews.title: Works Like a Charm!...especially on Voles.
customer_reviews.text: An amazing product at a 'humane' price. It took all of about 5-minutes to set up with just peanut butter for bait. I put it out just before sundown and in the morning these two buggers were caught. (...they've been relocated to the 'rodent relocation program' somewhere deep in the woods) I shared this with some Facebook friends who've had no luck getting rid of their Voles...they placed orders immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Elliott Francis

customer_reviews.title: So far working well
customer_reviews.text: So far working well. We've already caught several mice. We have learned to make sure we clean out between uses as sometimes "stuff" left behind that prevents from springing. Had to few times bait was gone but no mouse! May have been because we didn't clean between uses. Just ordered another set. We seem to have more mice this year than usual!! I'm thinking our cats bringing them in and letting loose after playing with them!!
customer_reviews.author: C G

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this model
customer_reviews.text: These traps did catch mice. However, there are two drawbacks. One, the catch mechanism that holds the door open is not designed well. One did not work after the first time I used it. The other issue is that there are only holes in the end that you are supposed to put the bait--the most common of which is peanut butter. When you do this, you will obstruct some of the air holes. I just ordered two traps on amazon from another manufacturer, supposedly of a stronger plastic(mice will chew the trap), and with air holes above and on the door, so the mouse will not suffocate.
customer_reviews.author: pet girl

customer_reviews.title: These did Not work even after 4 months and putting new baits inside
customer_reviews.text: After 4 months, neither of my 2 traps has caught a single mouse in my apartment. Neither peanut butter nor Swiss cheese was enough of a lure. While I initially preferred using this non-lethal method, it's Not effective. I ordered and used old fashioned snap traps 3 months ago and was able to kill 6 mice with them when placing most of them under my couch (which has a skirt touching the floor) so that their only method of detection was by smell.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Chang

customer_reviews.title: Cons - This was not as humane as I would like. The mouse tail was caught in the door
customer_reviews.text: Pros - It did work. Caught the mouse the first night I put it out. Cons - This was not as humane as I would like. The mouse tail was caught in the door. He was stuck with his tail caught from the time he was caught in the trap and when I found him, in the morning. In addition, his tail was broken, either from when the door snapped shut on it or from trying to free himself. The manufacturer could solve this flaw by providing a gap between the door and the container, as other live traps do. I will not use this product again but will order a more humane trap, next time.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Worked great! Still fine to use again.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only used it once, but it worked great. The mouse was just sitting quietly like, “When you thinking about about letting me outta here?” I took him out to the woods and let him out. No dead, bleeding, or injured mice to pry out of a disgusting trap. The mouse hasn’t chewed on the trap. There was lots of poop, but most of it came out when I shook the trap. The spring was still fine, so I reset it just in case he has a buddy. I love this trap!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Skipper

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: My fiancé spotted a small brown mouse walking around from time to time. I knew I didn’t want to kill the little guy so I ended up purchasing this set. They’re the size of an average size water bottle so if you’re looking for something to catch larger critters.. these won’t work for you! After putting a dab of peanut butter, caught “Jerry” the FIRST NIGHT! Super easy with no technical crap! I love the transparent casing so it’s easy to spot if you caught a little guy instead of relying on electronic lights that turn red/green/etc. that may not even be accurate. Ended up setting Jerry free at a local field but HIGHLY recommend!
customer_reviews.author: ayyychelsaaay

customer_reviews.title: Worked quickly when nothing else did!
customer_reviews.text: Had a mouse in the kitchen that was outsmarting my previous trap, so I tried this one and actually caught it within a few hours! The only problem was that the tip of its tail got caught when the door closed, but I pushed the door a tiny bit and it was able to pull it through. Caught it in the early evening and worried that it wouldn't survive overnight in the trap, but it was fine the next morning and release in a field far away was quick and easy. Left it some food to get it started in its new life.
customer_reviews.author: jennie r stever

customer_reviews.title: It works!!!!!!!!!! A+!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! It worked!! We had a mouse in our garage. My husband came home with those traps that sticks the poor guys feet and my daughter was crying heartbroken for the little mouse. So instead of using that we tried these! By golly it worked!!!!! Very easy to use. We caught the guy last night and released him this morning in a park nearby. GREAT product! Edit - we've now caught 4 mice within 24 hours!!! Wonderful! But one of the doors doesn't work now leaving us with only one trap. Too bad. But otherwise great!
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed product.
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to make the on the right. Simple design and really great to catch one mouse. However the internals shouldbe made of metal ut the thickness of the internals of the plastic tray are only strong enough to last one tiny mouses chewing. You can see in the right most photo how much has been chewed. Had the same problem with larger blue ones I bought. Damaged enough that the trapdoor no longer catches.
customer_reviews.author: NAP

customer_reviews.title: Very quick results!
customer_reviews.text: I was not expecting these traps to be as successful as they turned out to be. I was hearing and seeing traces of mice every day so I had to act. The instructions mentioned being patient so I put them out and didn't expect what happened. 10 minutes after putting them out I heard the sound of the door closing. I went and looked and there was a mouse. I let it go and placed the trap again and 15 min later it caught another. The next night I got another mouse. Since I have not heard or seen traces of mice. These traps worked and recommend them. Placement is important so they are concealed and in high traffic area.
customer_reviews.author: Downlinerz2

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I've been struggling with a family of mice in my house for several months now. These little mouse traps allow me to humanely capture the parents and the tiny babies safely and release them into the park down the street. Unfortunately, I've got one super smart mouse that licks up the pb I smear on the door to coax them inside and completely ignores the nice big glob on the back of the trap...hence the months long project to clear my house of the cute little massive mess creators :D Hopefully, hunger will eventually coax him/her into the trap...or out of my house! Oh, btw, I've caught like 15 mice or more with this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Dina Moody

customer_reviews.title: Love this trap
customer_reviews.text: Just got this out of my mailbox 20 minutes ago. It only took me maybe 3 minutes to set up, and I have caught a mouse no more then 10 minutes of placing it! I love this. I can't stand to kill any animals. They are just to cute, but they are a health hazard and I'm taking him far away from any home so he can't do no more harm. I don't see where to add a photo, or I would post the picture I took of the mouse in the trap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Caught two mice so far.
customer_reviews.text: We are using these as a substitute for a different kind of live trap - a simpler kind. The other kind has a door that only opens one way - in (no springs needed). However that kind - the mice can flip it and open the door if they are determined. Also it is no longer available. These seem to be working equally well. Neither of these two mice destroyed the trap - they were in there several hours, so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Customer Care

customer_reviews.title: Highly effective!
customer_reviews.text: I noticed some mouse droppings in the pan underneath my stove. I thought I had 1 mouse, but I caught 3 the first night and 1 on the second night! 😯 These work great without killing the mice. I know I’m not a person who could ever use snap traps or glue traps so I am thrilled these are working so well. I used fragrant peanut butter dog treats for the bait. I don’t have pets so the treat was something new they could not resist. I drove them over 5 miles away and released them.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie P.

customer_reviews.title: Great trap. Has been catching mice efficiently.
customer_reviews.text: With two traps placed, they're getting a mouse every other day or so. They have started doing better since we started using crushed peanuts and washing the trap after touching it so it doesn't smell like humans. The mice are fine in there for a while until we get a chance to release them in the park. Planning to order two more traps to cover more areas.
customer_reviews.author: A. Podolsky

customer_reviews.title: Easy catch and release
customer_reviews.text: I’ve caught 5 critters in various offices at my work. All but one were found alive the next day. The lone fatality came when a coworker checked up on the trap and discarded the mouse. I have my suspicions about what really happened since he also threw away the trap along with the mouse, claiming he didn’t know it was reusable. I still have one of the two traps and everyone has been safely set free.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Dowding

customer_reviews.title: Got em!
customer_reviews.text: 2nd day I installed these traps I caught one! Then the next day I caught another. I baited one with feta cheese crumbles & the other with some fruit. Seems they like the stinky cheese better as they had to pass the one with fruit in it to get to the cheese one. Only complaint is both times the mouse's tail got stuck in the door. Probably didn't hurt, but I would assume they would get their tail out if they could. I call it mouse jail. Then they get deported from my house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I had noticed a bit of scurring in my house but didn't want to use poison or traditional traps. I ordered this product and it arrived in 2 days. It was easy to set up. I just place a little peanut butter and set it in a corner. The next morning there was a little mouse in there. I took it out to a feild. All I had to do was open the door and put her went. I reset it and waited a few days just in case he had friends but I didn't notice any other scurring and didn't catch anything else.
customer_reviews.author: kristaleen

customer_reviews.title: Mice chew & break trap wayyy too quickly!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this product initially because it is humane and easy to use, but after catching 6 mice in 3 days, the mice have chewed the plastic part off of the product that allows the trap door to stay down and I cannot use these traps anymore (see video). It’s a bummer, I really loved the idea of trapping and releasing, but this product only worked properly 6 times. I got to use one trap once (first mouse destroyed it), and the second trap 5 times before it was destroyed. Again... I really liked this product at first, but I wouldn’t recommend it now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hack to get these to work best
customer_reviews.text: These will work, but only with this hack. They are able to slide the exit door up and escape, unless you put duct tape holding it down. Be careful not to cover the air holes with tape or peanut butter though. ALSO, these are only single-use. Both mice I’ve caught have chewed up the plastic interior, including the latch that holds the entrance flap open. This renders it unusable after each mouse. An exterminator told me the mice will dehydrate it suffocate within hours in these, so check them often. I highly recommend these instead of killing the mice
customer_reviews.author: Daniellacat

customer_reviews.title: Worked better then the kill traps!
customer_reviews.text: A live mouse trap that actually works! It worked better than the kill traps have used in the past . I've used this trap for the last couple years, and it gets them every time! I live near the woods and get field mice when it gets cold. Just release in a non populated area far from your home and leave some food for them. It says it can be cleaned but I just bought new when it was dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Serena

customer_reviews.title: It catches mice
customer_reviews.text: Mice in my house can pick the bait clean from snap traps so I tried humane traps. This is a very good alternative as long as you're prepared for dealing with a live mouse. Sticky traps have worked for me but they're very inhumane. The bait holder on this trap is a better design than similar traps I've tried. A couple almonds in the bait holder has worked best for me with this trap. For some reason the mice in my house have avoided peanut butter.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: An easy to set up humane trap
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I can only rate these traps based on how easily I was able to set up and use them. We were finding mice (actually our cats were finding them, killing them, and leaving us them as our present) so I bought these traps as well as a pest control ultrasonic repeller. Apparently the repeller did the trick because no more mice came into our house (sorry, cats). However, I do want to say that these are really easy to set up and I know it would’ve easily caught a mouse if they were still coming in so I highly recommend them and have them waiting for a day when the mice find their way in again.
customer_reviews.author: Snupydecat

customer_reviews.title: Best traps in the world
customer_reviews.text: Best traps in the world. Had them down 3 days caught 12 mice. Have tiny field mice, was worried the trigger might not be sensitive enough i put a small dab of peanut butter at the very back where the sliding door is just under and against the back under side of the trigger just enough so they can smell it, haven't had to rebait it yet and still catching mice effortlessly. Haven't tried just placing bait on the trigger, or seeing if the weight of the tiny mice alone would do it but certainly seems like it would.
customer_reviews.author: Karolyn A.

customer_reviews.title: Humane, easy to use, great buy!
customer_reviews.text: These traps are the real deal ! They are very easy to bait and set. They do a great job of keeping the rodents alive and are translucent allowing you to frequently monitor your traps allowing the best chance for the survival of the rodent. Some people in previous reviews said that their traps were tearing up after catching a couple mice but we haven’t had that problem! They’ve caught a total of 8 in the matter of one week and still in great condition. It even catches the little babies that we were afraid they would be too light to set the trap. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Porch

customer_reviews.title: You guys, these work
customer_reviews.text: Husband scoffed, neighbor scoffed, parents scoffed (when I told everyone my plan to use a live trap). Whatever, because I caught a mouse just about every single night that I rigged it up. (Surprise...our new-to-us 100-year old farmhouse was packed with mice—). No problems with mice chewing through the plastic, but I was pretty dutiful about checking traps in the mornings and not leaving them in there long. I really can’t think of a single complaint with these traps—cheap, easy to use, easy to release mice, and nice and small for easy storage. I am genuinely impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Not harmful to the mice at all!
customer_reviews.text: These work great! I love the instructions where it says to have patience. That's what it takes. Took a few days to catch the first one, and I kept checking every day. So, I was surprised when I actually saw one in there yesterday. But he was safe and unharmed (probably a lot scared) and I let him go outside. Today I woke up and there was another one in there, also unharmed. If you want to catch and release them without harming them, then this is the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: It works great!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had several of these types of mouse catching devices and this is the best one yet. I love it!! Great product that is easy to load with bait. Push & set the door and you are done. When caught, I can see the mouse. It's easy to release the critter when I place it in the witness relocation plan and move it far far away! Cleans up easy as pie. Just so you know, mice and rats love cherries. They work every time. I keep some frozen just for them.
customer_reviews.author: DEBORAH V GREGORY

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!
customer_reviews.text: i thought it wasn’t working... but then realized I had to put the door in the open position... once I did that I caught the mouse just a few hours later!! Really works well and I love that There is no cruelty involved!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennipurs

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product does what it advertises in spades! I have a mouse problem and I turn on my lights in the early morning to the sound of snap, snap, snap as they run from the light and smack into the traps. I suggest you clean the traps every few days to remove the scent of the frightened mice. It does help a lot. Peanut butter is another suggestion. They do love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark K.

customer_reviews.title: Very Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I tried three different kinds of traps, and this one caught the most mice using peanut butter as bait. With chickens, I end up with a lot of field mice coming in for the feed, especially in the fall and winter. The first 9 times I set these two traps, I caught a mouse in each one, every time (100%). The next 2 times I set them, I caught a mouse in one of them, but not the other, which was probably due to the location, and thinning out the mouse population.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and very effective
customer_reviews.text: These live traps are so easy to use. I had a whole family of mice living in my office. A little peanut butter lured each one in over the course of about a week. One note, if you have a cat and your reason to get these traps is to humanely release them, make sure your kitty can't get in the room. My cat found the trap with a mouse inside and the outcome was not good for the mouse (or my conscience).
customer_reviews.author: Nookers

customer_reviews.title: Easy, humane, clean mouse trap
customer_reviews.text: I found a mouse in our basement. (I was saving sunflower heads for seeds- possible attraction.) I couldn’t hurt him. I received my package today. Set traps with almond butter. Went outside to walk dogs. Mouse was caught by the time we arrived. I will keep traps out to be sure there are not more. Sorry cutie, it’s time to move out. Thank you! We caught a total of 8. A friend told us to expect 6-8 when you see one mouse. He was right. You can definitely reuse these traps or buy multiple sets. If the trap doesn’t reset easily, just gently pull on the inner clip to reset the door.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Gotcha! you little pest...
customer_reviews.text: This ingenious device will catch many mice. I have had a few lighter weight mice get in and out of it without tripping the latch. One caution although, even though I checked the traps after only setting them overnight, the frantic little rodents chewed the latch catch in an effort to escape rendering one of the traps unworkable. Thus the lower rating. A tougher material should be used for this design. I'l work on a better latch design.
customer_reviews.author: GreenHead

customer_reviews.title: Caught Fillipe First Night
customer_reviews.text: It had been raining very badly the past few days and one evening my nephew accidently left the interior garage open. That same night he claimed he seen “rat.” I didn’t believe it. Fast forward a few nights and then one morning I found a partially eaten grape on the kitchen floor. It was obvious that something small had been chewing on it. I ordered this mouse catcher and set it with cheese. In the morning “Fillipe” (that’s what we named him) was safely inside with the cheese. I took him down the street near some bushes and released him. Safe travels Fillipe!
customer_reviews.author: MissMorrison

customer_reviews.title: mice chew these up
customer_reviews.text: I caught seven mice with my two traps but by then the mice had chewed the plastic so that the door would not stay down and open. Also chewed the outside to try to get to peanut butter. Probably better in a house that doesn't have so many mice to begin with to eradicate. I'm moving on to tin traps. These worked great while they worked so I gave them a 3.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Schatzinger

customer_reviews.title: Best trap ever!
customer_reviews.text: I was upset because we had a mouse in our house, so I looked up humane traps and this seemed like a good idea. I've tried glue traps and others that didn't work either... Oh ... My ... Goodness. I've caught 3 mice in 1 day! I cannot recommend this one highly enough. No sooner had I released the first mouse from the trap (about a mile away from my house) than I caught a second one. No chance that I've caught the same mouse twice. I'm scared that I'll keep catching mice if I keep resetting the trap, but that's what I'm going to do.
customer_reviews.author: M. Milstein

customer_reviews.title: It catches mice better than anything i have used.... but it wont last long
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 4 of these and I have 1 working by salvaging parts from the others. They are made out of cheap plastic and the mice just chew through them. I enclose them in bricks so the bigger animals cant steal the whole trap (I have learned a lot about these traps in the past 3 months). They do catch the mice very well though. I wish they were made with thicker plastic and the catch for the door should be metal. they also seem to take off the removable back where you put the peanut butter but I seal that off with Duck Tape. I will be on the look out for a better version of this trap.
customer_reviews.author: Mike I.

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: This trap works very well indeed, and exactly as advertised, catching mice and larger rodents. However, I had something in my garage that would come in and eat the bait and not set off the trap. I had to take the trap apart and shave the gate to create a hair trigger for the trap. At this point, it worked too well, killing the tiny shrew that was to light to set off the trap. Overall, I was very impressed with the traps and would recommend them to my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great way to catch mice
customer_reviews.text: We had mice in our kitchen and utility room last winter, got these two simple live mice traps and caught two a night for several days until it stopped. Then I saw more mice droppings in the utility room this winter, put the traps back out and caught three in three days, then it stopped. Have the traps out but no more mice. Great way to get rid of the mice, we just put them out in the woods, far from any houses.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Lawniczak

customer_reviews.title: It works, but not good value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: It works, but not without faults. I caught one mouse the first night, but he chewed the plastic a lot. The trap is still functional but it’s probably only a matter of time until it’s chewed to ruin. I would have caught a second mouse with the other trap, but the mouse somehow figured out how to lift up the sliding door! So now I have to tape the doors shut when I set the traps... As I said, it works, but not worth the money so I probably won’t buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Alliwen

customer_reviews.title: Trap works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this thing works. After several weeks of unsuccessfully using traditional kill traps. We caught the mouse. Used Peanut butter. It would lick the other traps clean of PB without triggering it, "Jerry" was very clever. However, there is always a better mousetrap, and in the end, "Jerry" could not outsmart this design. Within 12 hours he was trapped, and set free in the woods far away, where it belongs. No more mouse obsessions or surprise squeals from a frightened wife in the laundry room. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Chaz Rowland

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: These are great in catching the mice we had in our basement. There were a few times when I went to check on the traps and the peanut butter we as gone and there was no mice (the door never tripped). Also, make sure to check the traps often, two of my traps were no longer usuable because they chewed on the catch that held the door open. Gave 4 stars because they are hard to clean if the feces dry onto the surface.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: My traps both arrived in perfect condition. I saw a few reviewers comment that theirs was broken. I have attached a picture of one of the traps with a mouse inside of it trapped. Literally the first day I set these traps down I caught two mice. The next time I used these traps I caught two more. They work incredibly well. I found it very easy to remove the back and set the bait in then set the trap. The caught and safely stored the mice until I was able to set them free elsewhere. I also thought cleaning them was very easy and they seem to keep the mouse inside safely without any harm.
customer_reviews.author: DSM

customer_reviews.title: Works great but some mice chew them up
customer_reviews.text: These traps work great with a dab of peanut butter. Catching plenty of mice with these but sometimes you get a uppity mouse and starts chewing on the trap. I have one that is chewed up pretty good but still works, it wont take to much more to damage it though. Maybe stick a poison pellet in the middle of the peanut butter?? Anyway I like these as I worry about other traps injuring my cat. Yes the cat is also catching mice as well :)
customer_reviews.author: Debra Tyler

customer_reviews.title: I had previously used a Tomcat trap but I didn't like that it was solid black
customer_reviews.text: I'd give this 5 stars, but the design has some flaws. I have to give it credit, I caught a mouse within a hour of putting it down with peanut butter as bait. I had previously used a Tomcat trap but I didn't like that it was solid black. With this trap you can see if you really got anything. My issue with it is that one time I didn't check it fast enough and the mouse was able to force the bait door open and escape.
customer_reviews.author: David F.

customer_reviews.title: Works great and a good alternative to traditional traps.
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit worried about the size of the traps. But I set 2 of them out and within a day I had actually caught 2. The rats were feeding on dog food so the trap has a space in the rear for the bait but I would suggest if you are going to be gone for a long time to at least put a small bit inside the trap for it to feed on. Because construction is a hard plastic it's possible for the rodent to eventually crack/eat through it. Easy catch and release...far far away.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Phillips

product_meta.title: Catcha 2 Piece Humane Smart Mouse Trap Live Catch and Release Rodents, Safe Around Children and Pets
product_meta.description: The humane way to remove unwanted mice! Catcha live mouse traps are a great alternative to snap traps or pesticides, allowing you to capture mice without killing them. How to catch a mouse? Place the bait (the recommended bait for this trap is beauty butter in a small compartment on one end, with open holes facing towards the inside of the trap. This lures the mouse inside, where the smell is coming from; open the gate on the another end, when mouse moving to the opiate end to access the bait, the mouse's weight moves to the far side of the fulcrum and triggers the trap, the gate closes; once you have the mouse captured, you can take the entire trap outdoors and lift the food compartment to open the trap. Then the mouse will run out; check the trap frequently as these mice can dehydrate of suffocate to death if left in the trap for a few days.
feature_bullets: EFFECTIVE: Catcha no kill mouse trap with a spring door that closes once the mouse go inside to eat the bait which you set. Once the door closes, the mouse can't get out until you open it up;
EXTREMELY SAFE: No poison; No glue; No touching mice or any dropping so no risk of disease; Safe around children and pets; Especially suitable for use at home;

EASY TO USE: Simply place the peanut butter in the compartment and open the spring door. When mice are caught alive and unharmed, all you have to do is take the trap out to a wooded area and release the mouse;
REUSEABLE: After releasing the mice, clean the mouse trap and set it again. It can be used over and over;
EXTREMELY HUMANE: No kill animals, endorsed by Humane Societies and Animal Rights Organizations in the U.S. and Worldwide.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars3,196 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
